sales module

class sales.app.Purchase(customer_username, good_name, price)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a purchase made by a customer.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Unique identifier for the purchase.

  • customer_username (str) – Username of the customer who made the purchase.

  • good_name (str) – Name of the good purchased.

  • purchase_date (datetime) – Date and time when the purchase was made.

  • price (float) – Price of the good at the time of purchase.

customer_username
good_name
id
price
purchase_date
query: t.ClassVar[Query]

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

sales.app.display_goods()[source]

Retrieve and display a list of available goods.

This endpoint calls the inventory service to get a list of goods that are in stock.

Returns:

A JSON response containing a list of goods with their names and prices.

Return type:

flask.Response

Raises:

500 – If there is an error communicating with the inventory service.

Custom error handler for 405 Method Not Allowed errors.

Parameters:

error (Exception) – The error object.

Returns:

JSON response with error details.

Return type:

flask.Response

sales.app.get_good_details(good_name)[source]

Retrieve detailed information about a specific good.

This endpoint calls the inventory service to get detailed information about a specific good.

Parameters:

good_name (str) – Name of the good to retrieve details for.

Returns:

A JSON response containing the good’s details.

Return type:

flask.Response

Raises:

  • 404 – If the good is not found in the inventory.

  • 500 – If there is an error communicating with the inventory service.

sales.app.get_purchase_history(customer_username)[source]

Retrieve the purchase history for a specific customer.

This endpoint fetches all purchases made by a particular customer.

Parameters:

customer_username (str) – Username of the customer whose purchase history is to be retrieved.

Returns:

JSON response containing a list of purchases.

Return type:

flask.Response

Raises:

500 – If there is an error retrieving purchase history from the database.

sales.app.make_sale(customer_username)[source]

Process a sale transaction for a customer.

This endpoint allows a logged-in customer to purchase a good. It performs the following actions: - Checks if the good is available in inventory. - Verifies the customer has sufficient funds. - Deducts the purchase price from the customer’s wallet. - Decreases the stock count of the purchased good. - Records the purchase in the database.

Parameters:

customer_username (str) – Username of the customer making the purchase (extracted from JWT token).

Returns:

JSON response indicating success or failure of the purchase.

Return type:

flask.Response

Raises:

  • 400 – If required fields are missing or if funds are insufficient.

  • 404 – If the good or customer is not found.

  • 500 – If there is an internal server error during the transaction.

Parameters:

f (function) – The decorated function.

The wrapped function.

function
